abstract.t: The document describes a mechanism allowing the use of DuplicateAddress Detection (DAD) by IPv6 nodes in a point-to-multipointarchitecture with "split-horizon" forwarding scheme. Based on theDAD signalling, the first hop router stores in a Binding Table allknown IPv6 addresses used on a point-to-multipoint domain (e.g.VLAN). When a node performs DAD for an address already used byanother node, the first hop router replies instead of this last one.
